WELCOME TO E-TERRA

The programme aims to create effective awareness in various levels (of society)
to reduce the adverse impact on environment and health arising out of the polluting
technologies used in recycling e-waste in the unorganized sector.

Why E-Waste is harmful?

In the contemporary digital age, the rapid evolution of technology has led
to a surge in electronic devices, contributing to a significant increase in
electronic waste, or e-waste. E-waste comprises discarded electronic devices,
ranging from smartphones and laptops to household appliances and industrial
machinery. The harmful nature of e-waste emanates from its toxic components,
including heavy metals like lead, mercury, and cadmium, as well as hazardous
chemicals.

When improperly disposed of, these toxic substances can seep into the soil
and water, posing severe environmental threats. Additionally, the informal
processing of e-waste in certain regions often involves unsafe practices,
leading to the release of harmful emissions and further exacerbating health
risks for both the environment and communities.

); } export default Body;
